meanings.definition: A type of salad green with bitter leaves.
meanings.sent1: I added some chicories to my salad for a touch of bitterness.
meanings.sent2: The chicories in the salad added a nice contrast to the other greens.
meanings.sent3: The chicories in the salad made my taste buds do a little dance.
meanings.sent4: Her personality was like chicories - a bit bitter but refreshing.
meanings.sent5: The chicories stood out in the salad, making it more interesting.

meanings.definition: The plural form of chicory, a plant in the dandelion family.
meanings.sent1: The farmers harvested chicories to sell at the market.
meanings.sent2: We planted chicories in our garden to enjoy fresh greens.
meanings.sent3: The chicories in the field swayed gently in the breeze.
meanings.sent4: The chicories dotted the landscape with their vibrant green color.
meanings.sent5: The chicories added a pop of color to the garden.

meanings.definition: The leaves of the chicory plant used in salads and cooking.
meanings.sent1: I picked some fresh chicories from the garden for the salad.
meanings.sent2: The recipe called for a handful of chicories to be added at the end.
meanings.sent3: The chicories in the dish gave it a unique flavor.
meanings.sent4: The aroma of the chicories filled the kitchen as they cooked.
meanings.sent5: The chicories added a delightful crunch to the salad.
